subject: Re: [junit] GUI Runner, Class Loader & excluded.properties
msgSnippet: My mistake was putting the file in the classes subdir, instead of classes/junit/runner .  Your code made that clear. Thanks. ... From: Mark Meyers
messageBody:
My mistake was putting the file in the "classes" subdir, instead of
"classes/junit/runner". Your code made that clear.

Thanks.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Mark Meyers" <markm@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 04, 2001 3:48 AM
Subject: RE: [junit] GUI Runner, Class Loader & excluded.properties


> The Exception you get is exactly what happens when you don't have excluded
> anything. So, what can go wrong:
> -properties file not first in search path
> -wrong properties file edited
> -with notepad: excluded.properties.txt saved
> -the syntax in the properties file is wrong (some keys contain spaces)
> -wrong path (/junit/runner/excluded.properties)
>
> If you have a batch file to start JUnit containing something like:
> c:\jdk131\bin\java -cp c:\work;xxx.jar;yyy.jar junit.swingui.TestRunner
>
> try to a simple class with main method to load and print the properties:
>
> ...
> public static void main (String args[]) {
> Properties prop = new Properties();
> InputStream
>
is=ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader().getResourceAsStream("junit/runner/excl
> uded.properties");
> if(is!=null){
> try{
> prop.load(is);
> }catch(Exception e){
>
> }
> }
> prop.list(System.out);
> }
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Scott Stirling
>
>
> What works for me and most people is to exclude:
>
> org.xml.sax.*
> org.w3c.dom.*
>
> Not just org.*
>
> Scott Stirling
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: David Corbin
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: 9/2/01 7:21 AM
> Subject: [junit] GUI Runner, Class Loader & excluded.properties
>
> I've run into a problem referenced several time here on the mailing
> list,
> but the work around doesn't seem to do anything for me.
>
> I extracted excluded.properties. Modified it to add "excluded.6=org.*",
> and
> placed it my classes directory (which IS the first thing in my class
> path).
> But, when I run the gui runner, I still get:
>
> java.lang.LinkageError: Class org/xml/sax/HandlerBase violates loader
> constraints
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:486)
> , , ,
>
> Any ideas? Would and include be simpler than an exclude for future
> versions?
>
>
>
